    • Method Detail

      • splitVideosToHSV

        public java.util.LinkedList<org.opencv.core.Mat> splitVideosToHSV(java.lang.String filename)
                                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Function that obtains hsv frames represented as MAT Objects from the video sent to it as parameter.
        Parameters:
        filename - String directing to the location of the video file. This videofile should be in .avi or .mp4 format and must be splitted into bgr frames.
        Returns:
        List of all the HSV files made from all the frames of the video. These HSV frames consist of pixels of three channels each, being the first one [0,360].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the video file format is not correct.

      • createVideofromframes

        public void createVideofromframes(java.util.LinkedList<org.opencv.core.Mat> frames,
                                  java.lang.String filename)
        Creates the a video file from a set of frames. It creates the file in the root folder of the project.
        Parameters:
        frames - Set of frames/MAT Objects.
        filename - The name of the file, including its extension (.avi preferred).

      • createScenes

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> createScenes(java.util.LinkedList<org.opencv.core.Mat> frames,
                                                           java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Boolean> cutsPos)
        Obtains the array of scenes (array of frames) based on the position of each cut.
        Parameters:
        frames - The total array of frames originally obtained at the beginning of the program.
        cutsPos - It has len = frames.len() -1 . Array of cuts between frame t and frame t+1.
        Returns:
        Array of scenes (array of frames).

      • obtainResOfLastVideoRead

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> obtainResOfLastVideoRead()
        This function returns the resolution (Width, then Height) as a collection of two integer values.
        Returns:
        Collection containing two integer values of the last video read. The first element is the width (# of pixels). The second one is the height.
